Function# bufattr_ioscheduled

macOS 10.15+

```
int bufattr_ioscheduled(bufattr_t bap);
```

## [See Also](/documentation/kernel/3325830-bufattr_ioscheduled#see-also)

### [Buffers](/documentation/kernel/3325830-bufattr_ioscheduled#buffers)

[`buf_alloc`](/documentation/kernel/1561906-buf_alloc)Allocate an uninitialized buffer.[`buf_attr`](/documentation/kernel/1561894-buf_attr)Gets the attributes for this buf.[`buf_bawrite`](/documentation/kernel/1561823-buf_bawrite)Start an asychronous write on a buffer.[`buf_bdwrite`](/documentation/kernel/1561858-buf_bdwrite)Mark a buffer for delayed write.[`buf_biodone`](/documentation/kernel/1561914-buf_biodone)Mark an I/O as completed.[`buf_biowait`](/documentation/kernel/1561908-buf_biowait)Wait for I/O on a buffer to complete.[`buf_blkno`](/documentation/kernel/1561926-buf_blkno)Get physical block number associated with a buffer, in the sense of VNOP_BLOCKMAP.[`buf_bread`](/documentation/kernel/1561851-buf_bread)Synchronously read a block of a file.[`buf_breadn`](/documentation/kernel/1561873-buf_breadn)Read a block from a file with read-ahead.[`buf_brelse`](/documentation/kernel/1561897-buf_brelse)Release any claim to a buffer, sending it back to free lists.[`buf_bwrite`](/documentation/kernel/1561886-buf_bwrite)Write a buffer's data to backing store.[`buf_callback`](/documentation/kernel/1561902-buf_callback)Get the function set to be called when I/O on a buffer completes.[`buf_clear`](/documentation/kernel/1561901-buf_clear)Zero out the storage associated with a buffer.[`buf_clear_redundancy_flags`](/documentation/kernel/1561898-buf_clear_redundancy_flags)Clear flags on a buffer. @discussion: buffer_redundancy_flags &= ~flags[`buf_clearflags`](/documentation/kernel/1561837-buf_clearflags)Clear flags on a buffer. @discussion: buffer_flags &= ~flags[`buf_clone`](/documentation/kernel/1561867-buf_clone)Clone a buffer with a restricted range and an optional callback.[`buf_count`](/documentation/kernel/1561820-buf_count)Get count of valid bytes in a buffer. This may be less than the space allocated to the buffer.[`buf_create_shadow`](/documentation/kernel/1561838-buf_create_shadow)Create a shadow buffer with optional private storage and an optional callback.[`buf_dataptr`](/documentation/kernel/1561881-buf_dataptr)Get the address at which a buffer's data is stored; for iobufs, this must be set with buf_setdataptr(). See buf_map().[`buf_device`](/documentation/kernel/1561922-buf_device)Get the device ID associated with a buffer.[`buf_dirtyend`](/documentation/kernel/1561850-buf_dirtyend)Get the ending offset of the dirty region associated with a buffer.[`buf_dirtyoff`](/documentation/kernel/1561923-buf_dirtyoff)Get the starting offset of the dirty region associated with a buffer.[`buf_drvdata`](/documentation/kernel/1561866-buf_drvdata)Get driver-specific data from a buffer.[`buf_error`](/documentation/kernel/1561818-buf_error)Get the error value associated with a buffer.[`buf_flags`](/documentation/kernel/1561844-buf_flags)Get flags set on a buffer.[`buf_flushdirtyblks`](/documentation/kernel/1561822-buf_flushdirtyblks)Write dirty file blocks to disk.[`buf_free`](/documentation/kernel/1561907-buf_free)Free a buffer that was allocated with buf_alloc().[`buf_fromcache`](/documentation/kernel/1561933-buf_fromcache)Check if a buffer's data was found in core.[`buf_fsprivate`](/documentation/kernel/1561929-buf_fsprivate)Get filesystem-specific data from a buffer.[`buf_fua`](/documentation/kernel/1561842-buf_fua)Check if a buffer is marked for write through disk caches.[`buf_getblk`](/documentation/kernel/1561932-buf_getblk)Traditional buffer cache routine to get a buffer corresponding to a logical block in a file.[`buf_geteblk`](/documentation/kernel/1561862-buf_geteblk)Get a metadata buffer which is marked invalid and not associated with any vnode.[`buf_invalblkno`](/documentation/kernel/1561843-buf_invalblkno)Invalidate a filesystem logical block in a file.[`buf_invalidateblks`](/documentation/kernel/1561910-buf_invalidateblks)Invalidate all the blocks associated with a vnode.[`buf_iterate`](/documentation/kernel/1561857-buf_iterate)Perform some operation on all buffers associated with a vnode.[`buf_lblkno`](/documentation/kernel/1561825-buf_lblkno)Get logical block number associated with a buffer.[`buf_map`](/documentation/kernel/1561890-buf_map)Get virtual mappings for buffer data.[`buf_markaged`](/documentation/kernel/1561845-buf_markaged)Mark a buffer as "aged," i.e. as a good candidate to be discarded and reused after buf_brelse().[`buf_markclean`](/documentation/kernel/1561834-buf_markclean)[`buf_markdelayed`](/documentation/kernel/1561911-buf_markdelayed)Mark a buffer as a delayed write: mark it dirty without actually scheduling I/O.[`buf_markeintr`](/documentation/kernel/1561892-buf_markeintr)Mark a buffer as having been interrupted during I/O.[`buf_markfua`](/documentation/kernel/1561841-buf_markfua)Mark a buffer for write through disk cache, if disk supports it.[`buf_markinvalid`](/documentation/kernel/1561863-buf_markinvalid)Mark a buffer as not having valid data and being ready for immediate reuse after buf_brelse().[`buf_markstatic`](/documentation/kernel/1561839-buf_markstatic)Mark a buffer as being likely to contain static data.[`buf_meta_bread`](/documentation/kernel/1561871-buf_meta_bread)Synchronously read a metadata block of a file.[`buf_meta_breadn`](/documentation/kernel/1561821-buf_meta_breadn)Read a metadata block from a file with read-ahead.[`buf_proc`](/documentation/kernel/1561855-buf_proc)Get the process associated with this buffer.[`buf_rcred`](/documentation/kernel/1561836-buf_rcred)Get the credential associated with a buffer for reading.[`buf_redundancy_flags`](/documentation/kernel/1561872-buf_redundancy_flags)Get redundancy flags set on a buffer.[`buf_reset`](/documentation/kernel/1561928-buf_reset)Reset I/O flag state on a buffer.[`buf_resid`](/documentation/kernel/1561835-buf_resid)Get a count of bytes which were not consumed by an I/O on a buffer.[`buf_set_redundancy_flags`](/documentation/kernel/1561865-buf_set_redundancy_flags)Set redundancy flags on a buffer. @discussion: buffer_redundancy_flags |= flags[`buf_setblkno`](/documentation/kernel/1561888-buf_setblkno)Set physical block number associated with a buffer.[`buf_setcallback`](/documentation/kernel/1561885-buf_setcallback)Set a function to be called once when I/O on a buffer completes.[`buf_setcount`](/documentation/kernel/1561852-buf_setcount)Set count of valid bytes in a buffer. This may be less than the space allocated to the buffer.[`buf_setdataptr`](/documentation/kernel/1561861-buf_setdataptr)Set the address at which a buffer's data will be stored.[`buf_setdevice`](/documentation/kernel/1561859-buf_setdevice)Set the device associated with a buffer.[`buf_setdirtyend`](/documentation/kernel/1561826-buf_setdirtyend)Set the ending offset of the dirty region associated with a buffer.[`buf_setdirtyoff`](/documentation/kernel/1561924-buf_setdirtyoff)Set the starting offset of the dirty region associated with a buffer.[`buf_setdrvdata`](/documentation/kernel/1561880-buf_setdrvdata)Set driver-specific data on a buffer.[`buf_seterror`](/documentation/kernel/1561934-buf_seterror)Set an error value on a filesystem-specific data on a buffer.[`buf_setlblkno`](/documentation/kernel/1561900-buf_setlblkno)Set logical block number associated with a buffer.[`buf_setresid`](/documentation/kernel/1561849-buf_setresid)Set a count of bytes outstanding for I/O in a buffer.[`buf_setsize`](/documentation/kernel/1561921-buf_setsize)Set size of data buffer.[`buf_setvnode`](/documentation/kernel/1561833-buf_setvnode)Set the vnode associated with a buffer.[`buf_shadow`](/documentation/kernel/1561877-buf_shadow)returns true if 'bp' is a shadow of another buffer.[`buf_size`](/documentation/kernel/1561917-buf_size)Get size of data region allocated to a buffer.[`buf_static`](/documentation/kernel/1561912-buf_static)Check if a buffer contains
